ps140: 7, Podoben “No longer are we forbidden the tree of life…”
That You might make man a god,* You became a man and were crucified, О supremely good Christ.* Glory be to Your power!
When the assembly of the Jews condemned You to die on the Cross, О Jesus,* the earth quaked and the sun hid its light.
The iniquitous assembly crowned You with thorns, О Immortal and holy King,* who cut off the thorns of delusion at the root.
aposticha: No longer are we forbidden the Tree of life,* for we have Your Cross as our hope.* О Lord, glory be to You!
Suspended upon the Tree, О Immortal One, *You broke the snares of the devil.* O Lord, glory be to You!
Glory be to You, О Christ God,* boast of the apostles and joy of the martyrs,* who preached the consubstantial Trinity!
When the all-immaculate one beheld You willingly nailed to the Tree,* weeping, she hymned Your dominion.
